title: robertcarlyle
author: robertcarlyle
content: If someone bought 1000 usd of bitcoin on January 1, 2011, would it make a huge difference buying on that date vs may 16, 2011 for the same amount? How much would that bitcoin be worth today if bought on January of 2011? 200 million usd or more? How would it make a difference?

comments.author: BitcoinBarrel
comments.body: Quote from: franky1 on November 14, 2024, 05:42:58 PM2011  1btc=jan 1st: $0.30may 16th: $7.102011  $1000=jan 1st: 3,333.33333333btcmay 16th: 140.84507042btc2024 $90k/btc3,333.33333333btc=$300,000,000.00140.84507042btc=$12,676,056.34Insane, still a millionaire tho...  Thanks for the calculation.

comments.author: Obim34
comments.body: We no longer need to live in the past, now let's do a calculation based on speculation2024 Nov = $90K2024 Dec = $100K 2025 (ATH) = $150K (+)Three more cycles from now, another set of millionaires will be made, the choices is ours to participate or not, the early investors already made theirs and now is the time we focused on making ourselves what we expect to become instead of keeping charts of instances that we were never part of.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: So OP is back with similar question again. Check the past post of OP and you would understand what I meant https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3656640;sa=showPosts

comments.author: robertcarlyle
comments.body: How much was bitcoin worth on march 26/27, 2018?  Would an approximate price be available?

comments.author: Cryptohygenic
comments.body: Quote from: robertcarlyle on November 14, 2024, 09:24:59 PMHow much was bitcoin worth on march 26/27, 2018?  Would an approximate price be available?Why making random questions about the historical prices of bitcoin without holding on to it? Like you're bored and just feel like asking questions even when they're are not going to be working documents for you.However, you can check further on   coinmarketcap  in case you want to stay updated about bitcoin prices.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: Quote from: robertcarlyle on November 14, 2024, 09:24:59 PMHow much was bitcoin worth on march 26/27, 2018?  Would an approximate price be available?AI will provide a better answer to you than asking past questions on the Bitcoin price whereby you have a phone and Internet connection. Don't be too lazy to search on Google about the Bitcoin price of any year or month you care to know

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Quote from: Ambatman on November 14, 2024, 09:24:35 PMSo OP is back with similar question again. Check the past post of OP and you would understand what I meant https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3656640;sa=showPostsHaha, nothing surprising right?Anway such things go on always but I'm impressed that you've noticed that, I was going to make the same calculation but above the first and second spots made it already clear and seems like according to OP's pattern it's not worth discussing.
